newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Metro hits year high on takeover talk.
newsitem.headline: Metro hits year high on takeover talk.

text.p: Retailer Metro Holdings touched a year high of S$6.20 in intraday trade on Friday before sliding to S$6.10, up 1.60, or 35.56 percent, at 0811 GMT.
Its turnover jumped up 5.18 million shares.
Dealers said speculation had been growing that Metro was a takeover target by First Capital Corp, which already owns a 5.6 percent stake in Metro Holdings.
The speculated takeover price was S$7.00 against Metro's estimated net asset value of $8.00 per share, the dealers said.
"The punters could be pushing the price up. If the rumour is true, the gains are definitely attractive," said a broker.
